definition: to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Her strategy was to be mistress of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 她的策略是成为地上树上两个世界都吃得开的能人。

sentences.english: There is evidence that the younger generation of women is thriving in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 有迹象显示，年轻一代的女性在职场上很吃得开。

sentences.english: He is the type of person who succeeds everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种到处都能吃得开的人。

sentences.english: You know her company? She has a big drag with the boss.
sentences.chinese: 你晓得她的公司吧？她在老板那儿很吃得开。

sentences.english: Help yourself, I hope you enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 自便哦，希望您能吃得开心。

sentences.english: Have you taken the Louvre at all, sir?
sentences.chinese: 您在卢浮宫里多少还吃得开吧，先生？

sentences.english: We had a lot of fun at the picnic.
sentences.chinese: 我们野餐吃得开心极了。

definition: be unpopular/won't work
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
popular/in demand/well regarded
lit. to strike water right and left (idiom)/fig. to turn everything into gold/to have everything going one's way/to benefit from both sides
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
rich and powerful (idiom)
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
relations with other people
to be considered as outstanding or special/to be reckoned with/notable
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话

definition: contacts/connections/network
to make it/to be somebody
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
